repo.name: annotated-container
repo.description: Dependency Injection framework to configure a PSR-11 Container with Attributes!

repo.name: annotated-container
repo.description: Dependency Injection framework to configure a PSR-11 Container with Attributes!

issue.title: Allow build command to specify a custom created Bootstrap
CLI tools do not provide option to use custom factory implementations
issue.body:
Currenty, the `build` and `validate` commands do not provide a way to use a `ParameterStoreFactory` or `DefinitionProviderFactory` outside of the default options. This effectively renders these commands useless unless you're using the default functionality.

To remedy this, we should do the following:

- Create a new facade (traditional OOP pattern) for easily running the Annotated Container CLI in just a couple lines of code.
- Document process for creating your own script, explaining why we suggest you do this.
- Deprecate the existing `bin/annotated-container`, suggesting use of the new documented process for creating your own script.

issue.title: Allow functional API to define an Attribute implementation
issue.body: In 2.x the functional API does not allow defining an Attribute on a Definition. Intuitively, this might make sense; after all, you aren't adding the Definition with an Attribute so there's nothing to supply. However, this does not take into consideration the possibility of custom Attributes. If these Attributes hold metadata, for example [in the PSR-15 microframework demo](https://github.com/cspray/annotated-container-microframework) the `#[Controller('GET', '/path')]` has routing data associated with it. If you were to use the functional API there'd be no way to provide this information.

comment.body: We need to give this much more thought. While the provided use case may be valid there are repercussions to how the functional API work. It would be better to wait for this feature until somebody has actually used a DefinitionProvider centric approach to wiring their Container while not making some use of custom attributes.
